body: $AAPL starting to wondering if I’m in the wrong market with a bunch of sheep selling off on the same news over and over. no I don’t expect it to skyrocket, but I damn sure don’t expect it to bottom when the same thing is said by a diff person. smh.
$AAPL going to be getting 155 outs for earnings to take advantage of the premium hikes
$SPY  still looks ugly. May try to base here soon but maybe bounce? Regardless, I'm thinking after $AAPL earnings is where most risk lies, whether Apple beats or not.

links.title: Apple's Newest iPhones Sold The Most In Q1
links.description: New research released ahead of Apple Inc's AAPL March quarter results, due on April 28, points toward strong uptake for the latest iteration of its iPhones. What Happened: The entire Apple iPhone 13 lineup had the largest share of the total iPhones sold in the U.S.

$AAPL Android’s Vast Global Mobile Market Share Shrinks While iOS Continues to Grow 

https://www.macrumors.com/2022/04/22/ios-grows-mobile-market-share/

links.title: Android's Vast Global Mobile Market Share Shrinks While iOS Continues to Grow
links.description: Android's vast global smartphone market dominance has shrunk slightly over the past four years while iOS has continued to increase its overall share, according to a new trend analysis. Google's Android OS is the most widely used in the world, with smartphone makers of all kinds relying on the mobile operating system to power their devices.

links.title: Patrick Spence, CEO of Sonos on Fighting Giants and Finding the Sweet Spot of Hardware and Software - Howard Lindzon
links.description: Panic with Friends - Investing for Profit and Joy Today's guest is an incredible leader building an incredible company. Patrick Spence is the CEO of Sonos ($SONO), a $3.5 billion dollar hardware audio company. Before Sonos, Patrick spent 13 years at Research in Motion (Blackberry) ultimately running global sales.

links.title: Patrick Spence, CEO of Sonos, on Fighting Giants and Finding the Sweet Spot Where Fashion Meets Technology (EP.198)
links.description: Listen to this episode from Panic with Friends - Howard Lindzon on Spotify. Today's guest is an incredible leader building an incredible company. Patrick Spence is the CEO of Sonos ($SONO), a $3.5 billion dollar hardware audio company. I get excited because this is one of those companies I like to call fashology - where fashion meets technology.
